reviews.review: Very great action and visuals. As many have said, if you didnt like the last Jedi, youll like this. That being said, between weird plot choices, lackluster light saber battles and other issues, the movie was held back from being truly great. I wish they kept one writer/director for the whole trilogy. Woulda made a difference in my opinion.

Being a Star Wars fan my whole life and being deeply invested in the EU I REALLY have not liked a lot of the stuff disney has done.  That said this movie was actually very enjoyable for me and my friends, and it gave Rey and Poe a lot of needed character building.  And it made sense!  So now Rey isn't so much a Mary Sue and Poe is no longer a random storyless background guy of sorts.

All in all I will always love 1-6 +EU (Aka Legends) more than Disney's cannon, but I must say I do recommend this movie as it is quite a good watch.

This made me like the last Jedi more as it gave more context to some of the choices. A little rushed pacing wise but I get it’s because of how much they needed to cover. I just wish they made a few more scenes that focused on the connections between characters. A couple moments that didn’t fit for me but overall it’s a movie that I had fun watching and would recommend.
Best movie from the trilogy I loved it!!!

I liked how they ended the movie, disliked the journey they took getting there.  I feel they tried to fit alot of storyline into one  2 hour 35 minute movie. They should take advice from the Russo bros and make two movies out of this one.....
They did a good job of bringing back previous key characters. It had a couple twists but nothing really earth shattering. Good movie but not great.

When I was growing up and the Star Wars-vs.-Star Trek battle raged, I ranked as a Trek fan. However, while still appreciating Star Trek – particularly the Kirk, Spock and McCoy relationship in the original series and related movies – I gradually have become much more of a Star Wars than a Star Trek fan. Why? I came to an answer only recently. In the end, Star Wars has more heart than Star Trek. And yes, Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker has plenty of "Star Wars heart."

You know that person you dated but it ended amicably? They are likeable but just not for you/you for them. 

Rise of Skywalker is like agreeing to hang out with that person. For nearly 3 hours. They spend those hours either reminding you of the good times you had years ago. Yeah, good times. Eventually it gets weird. They want "make up" for past perceived transgressions that you either forgot or didn't recognize at the time. Then it gets weird. They start acting DESPERATE for you to like them again. Why?! Why try SO HARD to make everyone in your orbit like you? The harder they try the more you cringe. Still, they're sweet. You get the closure you need from them/for yourself whether you needed it or not.

Probably my favorite of the sequel trilogy.  A very fun and satisfying ending, with scenes that almost brought tears to my eyes.  I'm thankful to say I'm one of those who can still enjoy these movies as they were mean't to be enjoyed, and not take them as serious as many star wars fans do.
Though it had to spend a lot of time fixing the last movie, I thought it was great!
